title: More efficient disk sorting logic needed for handling border values in row data
description: The current logic for disk sorting is not efficient when there is a border value specified for the number of rows to be processed. It performs the following operations:
OB:
1. Saves the file as a temp file
2. Calls the file to memory
3. Sorts the data
4. Saves the file to a temp file
EB: The system should improve the logic for disk sorting when a border value is specified for the number of rows to be processed. It should optimize the steps involved in the sorting process to increase efficiency.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Sort 40,000 rows of data on disk
2. Set the program to process less than 40,000 rows
3. Observe the following operations being performed:
   a. Saving the file as a temp file
   b. Calling the file to memory
   c. Sorting the data
   d. Saving the file to a temp file
